website_summaries.verdict: Designed with beginners and hobbyists in mind. The included rock mix is colorful and appealing to younger users, and the retail price point cannot be beat.
pros: A true hobbyist kit, includes everything – stones and all levels of grit and polish
cons: Some rocks can break into pieces, not polished
Instructions can be vague on grit levels and process
Some reports of missing materials and parts

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended
customer_reviews.text: Because this product was offered by National Geographic, I trusted that the quality would be decent. The tumbler didn’t make it through even one cycle before breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Gwendell

customer_reviews.title: Edited Review Customer Service is fabulous!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can only give this tumbler 3 stars. It worked great in the beginning. But during the third batch of rocks, it slowed to a crawl. I replaced the belt, and it still slows to a crawl and I ended up purchasing another one of a different brand. 4/19/2018 I am editing my review as National Geographic's Customer service is absolutely excellent and they are sending me a replacement base. I am changing it from 3 to 4 stars and will edit my review again once my rocks are completed. :)
customer_reviews.author: Melody C Arneil

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful news!!!!
customer_reviews.text: My original review was that the tumbler had stopped working after 1 day. I had even started the process to send it back. But right before I put it in the return box, I tried it once more and it worked! And it has been working non stop! I guess it was just a fluke! I am so glad! It is really a sturdy little machine.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Hicks

customer_reviews.title: worked great once, then leaked everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I ran it great for the first round with a coarse grit. Then I went to change the grit, and an hour later I looked and it had leaked everywhere. Oh well, my fault, I did something wrong. I cleaned up the mess, cleaned everything properly, assembled super carefully, and then started it back up. About 30 seconds later the device started blinking red, beeping, and it was leaking everywhere again. I'll be sort of cleaning it up, putting it back in a box, and sending it back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Eric F

customer_reviews.title: we want our son to enjoy this. extremely disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son who loves all things science and from day 1 it didn't work. we contacted seller before the 30 days and was told to try it with another band, that didn't work as well. we contacted AGAIN after 30 days and ofcourse its too late to do anything. All we want is for the product to work. we want our son to enjoy this. extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Szlachetka

customer_reviews.title: everything was tumbled just fine, but none where polished at the end
customer_reviews.text: I tried it twice, and seriously followed the instructions... everything was tumbled just fine, but none where polished at the end. They're all so dull.
customer_reviews.author: Crista

customer_reviews.title: Bad bearings
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived ok, set up ok, worked for about 2 months and I polished several batches of stones per directions and then a bearing went out in the drive motor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a great purchase! Before and after pictures taken
customer_reviews.text: Such a great purchase! Before and after pictures taken. We bought this for our 5 year old daughter but it’s just as much of a gift for the entire family. It’s a great family activity and I highly recommend it. Follow the directions and it’s easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mega reviews

customer_reviews.title: Ample patience required
customer_reviews.text: Works as promised. Rocks come out polished. The rocks included with the unit are a great sampling of tigers eye, rose quartz, etc. However, the polishing process takes so long that the child may lose interest. I bought this for my nephew who is 8...as most 8 year old boys do, he has a short attention span. Mom and Dad keep bringing this back to his attention so that it doesn't just end up in a pile of forgotten toys. The polishing process literally takes weeks and weeks.
customer_reviews.author: EllieMae

customer_reviews.title: Dull stones
customer_reviews.text: The reason I’m giving this only 2 stars, is because the pictures in the advertisement are very misleading. If you expect shiny stones as a end result, you will be disappointed. I had every step running on the longest setting and all the stones are dull. It took about 5 weeks for the process to finish and the tumbler is pretty quiet. I would not buy this again since the shiny store bought looking stones you see in the picture is not what you get. I’m very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Susanne M. Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Not the best for apartment living
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I turned this on, I felt the vibrations all over my apartment. It’s nicely made and water definitely doesn’t leak out of it. I’ve found putting it on towels or other things to pick up the vibrations and sound helps, but living in an apartment with neighbors under me, this isn’t the best tool to use for a month straight. I expected the sound and vibration to be less of an issue with this one because it was the “better” model and I’m not sure what the others are like, just something to consider when buying! If I had a garage or something outdoors, this wouldn’t be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Patience is key!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the lower noise thanks to the rubber drum and I'm pleased with most of the results. Not much grit included so I was glad I bought more with the unit. Also bought pellets and was glad I did because they can make a huge difference between damaged and poorly finished rocks. Couldn't get the polish to work, though, and found out adding a small amount of borax worked better (our water is hard here). Some people use ivory soap flakes. Overall liked the product but now find I'd like a larger one for the course and medium grinds and maybe use the smaller one (this one) ONLY for the pre-polish and finish polish.
customer_reviews.author: K Myers

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work, short circuits after a minute or two ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work, short circuits after a minute or two. No matter how few rocks are in the tumbler. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID J. YOUNG

customer_reviews.title: National Geographic would not help
customer_reviews.text: I used the tumbler once and it worked great if it had continued to work this would be a 5-star review, however, after the first batch was finished and I started the second batch the tumbler would stop and all the lights would flash red. I tried to restart, took some rocks out of the tumbler, and as a last resort when to National Geographic website to ask if they could help me. Their response was to contact Amazon since I didn't buy it from them. So I did and as usual, Amazon had great customer service, return label and gift card within 30 minutes. I am really disappointed that this product did not hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Vinny & Josie's GiGi

customer_reviews.title: Does not polish to a shine
customer_reviews.text: Would prefer to give zero stars but to leave review you have to give at least one. Followed directions to a T, shrunk my rocks and no shine. I have beach rocks that shine brighter than these. Machine tumbles to smooth but zero shine. Rock selection that came with tumbler was disappointment. My photo shows the sad finished product. Guide says use mineral oil for shine. Really?! I can do that for untumbled rocks and make them shine. My kids had a little tumbler that polished nicely. Don’t waste your money or your time on this tumbler. Not worth it at all.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: As my daughter's gift, we love it. The rubber barrel makes it much quieter than the tumblers back in the 1970's and 80's. It's still loud enough to require putting in a back room with the door closed. (It would make a good white-noise generator for the sleep deprived.) Documentation reports that it takes about a month to finish a set of rocks. I was surprised how well the first two stages have processed. It only comes with enough grit for one batch. It seems sturdy and should last a lifetime. Edit: don't keep your lapiz luzi in the whole time they disintegrate into non-existence.
customer_reviews.author: NX

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for Christmas for my son. We put all of the stones, plus a few more we had into the tumbler. There are 4 grits, all of which need to run for around 6-7 days. (sounds like a bathtub was filling with water, kind of soothing). After 28 days, out come the rocks, more smooth, a LOT smaller, however without the shine that was promised. We rinsed out the tumbler each time, followed the directions to the letter, and totally anticlimactic this evening when we finally were able to see our rocks. Zero clue as to why we didn't get the shine. Would love to find out!!
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Hempton-fink

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a rockhound
customer_reviews.text: Arrived exactly as expected, this little thing is way more heavy duty than I thought it would be! got it for a rockhound and he was happy there was different types of grit and a few items to make jewelry with. He was very impressed with the digital setting/display. Couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.author: kayoss

customer_reviews.title: Educational Fun for Inquisitive Six Year Old with Adult Supervision
customer_reviews.text: This was gift for 6 year old granddaughter. The item arrived in estimated time. It was well packed and without damage. We like that the kit included everything required for initial use. I am glad that I purchased tumbler with rubber coating to reduce noise when in use. The instructions are very clear and easy to follow. We were all surprised at how long the complete polishing process takes. Waiting a couple of weeks to go through process using three grades of sand is a long time for a six year old but results worth the wait. Our granddaughter will enjoy this for many years. For now, she requires adult supervision to follow instructions exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Phurrough

customer_reviews.title: Fine for someone who won't use this device every month.
customer_reviews.text: Was good for about 3 months then quit working. My daughter used it non-stop and maybe it wasn't ment to be used all the time but it takes 3-4 weeks to just do one batch of rocks from rough stone to smooth rock. Wish it was more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Arya W.

customer_reviews.title: ... a week but find it is doing the job pretty good. I did not get this for rock ...
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this for a week but find it is doing the job pretty good. I did not get this for rock tumbling but for sea glass. I get a lot of pieces that just aren't frosted enough or have a shiny chip. I don't need to do all the steps as I don't want it polished- just roughed up. Had to experiment with timing but got satisfactory results.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Reader

customer_reviews.title: Fun to start with, but doesn't "polish"
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun hobby tumbler that will round and smooth rocks, but the grit provided absolutely will not polish the rocks provided. Fortunately it isn't the fault of the tumbler. You can buy some Aluminum Oxide grit and it will work fine with this tumbler and you can get a great polished look. Also get some ceramic (not plastic) pellets if you're buying additional grit as those greatly improve the process. Note that this applies to the mat Geo refill packs as well. They provide nice rocks of an appropriate size, but final "polish" grit isn't good enough to get the look that most people would think of as polished.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: 9/20/2020 I received the tumbler on 9/18/20 but just opened it today. I bought it for my granddaughter and wanted to make sure I knew how to use it before giving it to her. I am so disappointed that there is no rock strainer, no 4 bags of polishing grit. If I can't get in touch with the seller, I will be returning it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jenks

customer_reviews.title: Works maybe a little too well?
customer_reviews.text: When I was younger I had an ancient model of these and I just remember the process taking a very very long time. They give you all stages of grit but honestly I get super smoothed out gorgeous rocks with just 1 week + maybe a few more days of tumbling. Is my tumbler tumbling too well? Is this a complaint? I'm not sure Regardless, I've created a lot of super gorgeous awesome looking rocks with this baby, what am I gonna do with them? I have no idea. But I have them.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Wink

customer_reviews.title: Quality control not so good...
customer_reviews.text: Received today and upon opening the box I found 2 small screws laying loose inside. They turned out to be the motor mounting screws. Wow! What kind of quality control is this? I had to remove the motor pulley in order to mount the motor to the case. After mounting the motor which was just flopping around inside the case I was able to reinstall the pulley and drive belt. The machine operates now but I'm sure unimpressed with it's condition upon arrival. We'll see how it performs and update this review afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Tone

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I am new to Tumbling. I had no idea the time required. That said. I purchased this and learned alot! I was working on my 2nd Tumble ..... 7th week. The Tumbler motor failed. Really?? For those that do not know, each stage of the process takes about a week. One would think with that kind of time required the Tumbler would be built to last last, what, 2, 3 Years? Yes, I am aware of Warranty, Bad Batches, etc. But you want a honest review of a product, this was my experience. Now I will start the process of 'Warranty'. :-)
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Tumbler Lousy Wheel Assembly
customer_reviews.text: I Love my tumblr. It's been a dream of mine since I was little to have one. I'm riding on cloud 9 learning the different types of stones & how long it takes. I sure wasn't expecting over 4 weeks to do a batch, but it's worth it. Now 4 polishing! The 2nd batch proved too much for the rubber band running it. The 2nd pic is it deteriorating & probably going into the vent.
customer_reviews.author: KAREN THEISS

customer_reviews.title: Product works, manufactures are shady AF
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. Pretty handy. But noisy as hell. From 4 rooms away sounds like a washing machine on low. But my kid loves it. The only reason I gave it such a low rating is because with it they give you this card for a discount on your next order of grit. The card expires 7 months from now in 12/20. Amazon, however, does not recognize the promo code. And I think fraudulent offers like that get you an automatic 0 gold stars.
customer_reviews.author: EljayTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product. We purchased this for our autistic son who decided recently he was into gem stones. With the Coronavirus we didn't feel comfortable taking him out somewhere and a lot of place had not reopened so we decided to make our own dig site and allow him to dig for gems and them tumble them smooth. I'm attaching a video, only the 1st video showing the product and the beginning of out tumble process,, because Amazon won't let me load them all.. Don't let the thought of there being several steps discourage you from this product. It's very easy and a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryll Craig

customer_reviews.title: I'll tumble for you
customer_reviews.text: I love the possibilities. So many crystals and rough stones to tumble and research. The noise is the sacrifice you must make for the beauty that is returned to you. I keep my tumblers in my basement. Yay!! The process taught me patience. Something that's eluded me my entire life. Please understand there are 4 steps each 7 day minimum. There's no choice but to be patient and trust the process. It's absolutely beautiful. I recommended purchasing stones and /or crystals 2 inches in size because after tumbling they reduce in size significantly. This review comes after purchasing the National Geographic Starter Kit. Those stones became a very small example of what could be!
customer_reviews.author: GirlfriendNJ

customer_reviews.title: Worth the time!
customer_reviews.text: My 4 y/o and I love it. Recommend buying mineral oil, extra grit and rocks you'll need it. Some stones dont need the full 4 step cycle, we lost a few that looked great after steps 1 and 2 but withered to pebbles during 3 and 4. I'd recommend doing a bunch of level 1 grit batches first, especially for younger kids. It's the shortest tumble time and will keep the littles intrested. Then once you have a nice batch you can decide which to keep the way they are, which to tumble with level 2 grit and repeat the process for fit 3 & 4. Its about a full month of tumbling start to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G

customer_reviews.title: It just doens't work
customer_reviews.text: I am soooooooooooo disappointed. I bought this for my daughter and we religiously did this for the required 30 days, changing the grit each Monday. Nothing looked any differently at the end aside from some oF them disappearing. Soooo, being determined, I went ahead and reordered more grit - 4 bOttles and did it fir another whole month WITH THE ROCKS WE HADN'T USED YET and NOTHINGGGGGGGGGGGGGGGG. A TOTAL WASTE OF MONEY, TIME AND ELECTRICITY.. Who can I contact for a refund of both the machine and the extra set of grit. VERY disappointed. Actually the first item from Amazon I wanted to return for a refund. Not sure to whom to direct such a request. Pat Hunt, St Maarten
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Hunt

customer_reviews.title: My 10 year old son loves it!!
customer_reviews.text: I hoped this would be a big hit and it is. Really powerful and effective tumbler and the results are amazing. Seems like a really powerful and solid machine. Packaged extremely well for shipping. He is obsessed. Comes with rocks, grit, and some jewelry project pars which are actually quite nice. Impressed with the quality. Don't hesitate if you want a quality kit that will get lot's of use.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: My kids, 9yo and 7yo, and I are working on the final polish now. It is fun to see their reactions each time we open it to change polishes. They are looking forward to finding more rock's this summer to polish. Noise level isn't terrible, it's slightly louder than the sleep sounds they play about equal to an old box fan. The tumbler sits on the floor at the end of my daughter's bed, after the first night everyone is so used to it we don't hear it until shuts off. The directions are great! Very well detailed, clearly written with explanations, and very easy to understand.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, Well Made, Quiet !
customer_reviews.text: This tumbler is well made and surprisingly quiet. However, quiet is subjective. The rubber liner really helps dampen the noise though. TIP: If you want to further reduce noise, put the tumbler inside an insulated cooler and close the lid ! The cooler needs to have a drain plug so the power wire can be routed through it. I'd say this approach reduces the noise by at least half. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: NC Bill

customer_reviews.title: Simple, easy & fun
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. The rubber drum cuts back on the noise but it’s still something you’ll want on a different floor when your sleeping. We have it downstairs and I can still hear the steady hum/heartbeat kind of noise through the floor. But it works exactly like I wanted it to. I have not used it for tumbling rocks so I can’t speak to how well it does that but add a broken bottle and a couple of scoops of sand from the beach and 3-5 days later you have sea glass! SO simple to use, I can’t wait to use it with my grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy McIvor

customer_reviews.title: Save your money!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son in March, we loved it. It was a fun experiment. I just broke today, 5 months later. We have bought so many rocks for it, tons of different grit, it feels like a waste. We have a load on rocks in it right now that I don’t know what to do with. I’m very disappointed. I don’t recommend buying this brand, it should have lasted longer than 5 months.
customer_reviews.author: Desiree DeeLight Trogdon

customer_reviews.title: Probably the same design since 1982,  but love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great kit, perfect for our 5 y.o. and 3 y.o. to learn about rocks, the forces of nature, and to teach delayed gratification. Got it yesterday, set it up, and it is still in the corner of the back room spinning (not to loud, but noticeable when next to it) as it will be till we change out the grit in 3 days. The rocks it came with are awesome and the Jewelry kits for placing the finished rocks in will be a very fun instance and make great presents for aunts and grand-mom. Only had it a few days so I will adjust my review if it breaks.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I am totally addicted to rock & glass tumbling! I've always picked up little treasures along my hikes & beach trips since forever! & I am stoked every time to refill & unlock this tumbler. Great little machine! No regrets! It holds one pound of rock or glass.. The barrel isn't that big.. If I would have known how in love I'd be I would have invested in a larger contraption.. Really great beginner tumbler.. Also comes with a bag of rough stones which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Tylor

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service
customer_reviews.text: We enjoyed using this rock tumbler at first. Had to use it in the garage because of the noise. It worked fine through one batch of rocks using all four stages of grit and the finished product looked awesome. I sprayed them with clear acrylic and they're so fine. That was all we got out of the tumbler. We started on the second batch of rocks and the tumbler pooped the bed. Oh well! UPDATE: Emailed their customer service and had a replacement delivered in just a few days. Amazing customer service.
customer_reviews.author: k s 4 2 4 4

customer_reviews.title: Great buy. Treat your self ;)
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome. It's quite. You get a good set of instructions. The tumbler. A little strainer type piece. Some grit. Some stuff to attach your stones to so you can wear them. And some stones to tumble. I bought this for myself because I've always wanted a rock tumbler. Is says for ages 8 and up but this is great for adults too.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't run.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't run. I have taken out rocks, emptied out water, and simply plugged it in; if the setting lights do not start flashing automatically, it runs for about 25 seconds until it stops and the lights begin to flash. I received this on the 1st, and I am just now trying it out.
customer_reviews.author: kbe89

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: This said it had only minor dings on it. However it was missing the entire barrel for tumbling and the rocks. I am only giving one star due to missing parts. I will update after a new order because my kids are huge rock collectors. Amazon verified thos? Shame on them.
customer_reviews.author: Kristie  Opray

customer_reviews.title: Fun-no shine
customer_reviews.text: Pictured is the rock pack that came with the tumbler. This is what they look like after about a month of doing all 4 grit steps. Ran the last 10 days with a bit of mineral oil in with the grit as some reviewers said it would help with the shine. All it did was make a very messy tar like substance that I had to use dawn dishsoap to remove from everything it touched. Dont do it! The machine itself we put in the basement to not have to listen to it, but didnt think it was so loud it needed to be in a garage or anything.
customer_reviews.author: J. Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Loud But Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, this is WAY louder than I expected. We actually got it for our kids, but we ended up putting it in the garage when it works. So, don't think this is a toy you can running in the living room or in your kids' room. However, it's also awesome! The kids and I went around the neighborhood and collected random rocks and started tumbling them. We got a book about rocks and gems, and we've loved seeing what our dull stones are turning into. I highly recommend this to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: It broke and spilled everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this a better review. It was great at first. But on the 3rd use, it opened up and spilled everywhere. I had it capped very tightly too. Really upset about the mess.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Alders

customer_reviews.title: Good tumbler for a beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great little tumbler. My only disappointment is the selection of stones and fastenings. We are only on the pre-polish cycle and I've noticed most of the stones are withered down to nothing, a jasper broke. I will be buying raw stones from a different source to see if they turn out better. Overall the tumbler itself is great, the extras (jewelry fastenings and rough gemstones) were less than desirable. I honestly only used the key chain option. But considering they were "extras" I just looked at it as a trial and error learning experience. I can buy more grit and stones and the tumbler is still well worth it as a birthday gift to my son.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-9

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift to my 8 year old rock-lover and it was a huge hit with the whole family. Yes it takes patience, we started these rocks on Christmas morning and kept it going non-stop and we just finished the last cycle yesterday (Jan 18th) and we used the minimum recommended days on each cycle. Yes, it's a little loud, it's a rock tumbler! But we didn't mind the noise. Tip: be sure to clean out the tumbler well between cycles so that all old grit is removed, otherwise your rocks will never get shiny.
customer_reviews.author: ever1sevilla

customer_reviews.title: It's not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: It didn't polish the rocks. So started second batch of rocks. The first round of polishing went fine. The 2nd step, the tumbler would go about 15-20 seconds, stop and flash all the lights then wouldn't start again without unplugging and plugging back in. Then it would only run 20 seconds. The problem is, i'm past the 30 days to return it, so I'm stuck with a tumbler that doesn't work or run! I would not recommend anybody buying this item!
customer_reviews.author: MIke

customer_reviews.title: I just started "tumbling" the rocks yesterday so as far ...
customer_reviews.text: I just started "tumbling" the rocks yesterday so as far as the quality of the unit and the ease of putting it together, it's a 5 star. Since it will take several weeks for the finished products, I'll come back and edit my review. I recently moved to a mountainous (rocky) area of New Mexico and bought this for a project for my 8-year-old grandson and I for the summer. Since there are plenty of rocks here, it will be interesting to see how they shine up. I have it in a downstairs room and it doesn't make too much noise there. It may have to be moved to the garage when company comes, though.
customer_reviews.author: Paulette Binion

customer_reviews.title: Rock collection gone through
customer_reviews.text: Kept in the laundry room the limited noise is not a problem. Has been working almost constantly for over 6 months. Doing the tumbling is a little trial and error even with online research ahead of time. Everything is not a gem lol. Happy with the results and continue to use. Not sure if it came from the seller or another source but 7 days is not enough for many types of stone/gem. Good Purchase and Durable. Easy to clean and use. NOTE for newbies clean out and rinse contents outside do not send down drain or it will cause problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, Easy to Use, Easy Set Up!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for out rock loving 7 year old, and she loves it. It is quiet enough for her to keep in her bedroom, and she actually enjoys the "white noise" that it gives it night. I love that it does not come with a bunch of confusing pieces to assemble. It really is easy enough for her to figure it out on her own, although I pour the grit because I don't want her breathing it in or spilling it. The results are stunning, even when we put whatever rocks we found in our yard. They turned out beautifully polished and smooth. I do recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Sherilyn Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Put this where you can keep an eye on it but it is good.
customer_reviews.text: I still stand by keeping it where you can keep an eye on it. Make sure the rubber stop is inserted and snug before adding the metal lid. It is not good if the lid is even slightly loose or the rim is dirty so it don’t seal. It works well and comes with a set of abrasives good for one project and does not include and filler beads. Once you get it going it is pretty easy. Not too loud to me as I shut out the sound and only notice it when it stops. I think it is pretty quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Lemons

customer_reviews.title: Not quite right.
customer_reviews.text: This was complicated for my 8 year old. It’s very very noisy even in the garage. If you follow the directions 100% it leaves the rocks dull. They appear over processed. Early in the phases they start shiny. I believe at some point it just starts basically burning the dirt/ grit into the surface instead of polishing any more. Recommending stopping sooner - whenever they appear shiny still.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Cherry

customer_reviews.title: Great for child’s learning
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 9 yo daughter who showed an interest in rocks on a recent WI trip and she loves it. Yes, it makes noise so put it in a spot where you won’t care. And thank goodness the barrel is rubber! I can’t imagine the noise level if it weren’t. We keep it in the basement in the back at my husbands tool area so it’s not a bother to us. It does need to stay on for days at a time. But each phase is anticipation of how the rocks take a new shape. Science in action! So glad we got this for her!
customer_reviews.author: Emilyday

customer_reviews.title: IT'S SO LOUD but it does its job
customer_reviews.text: Tik Tok influenced this decision but did not inform me how loud this tool would be. I had to put this in my basement because it's unbearably loud. I used my own rocks instead of the small ones provided in the kit. Overall, my rocks looked great afterward. The polishing grit does NOT make your rocks shiny, it just makes them smooth (i'd recommend rubbing coconut oil on them after).
customer_reviews.author: Shelanda L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Love our rock cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing! Bought this as a science experiment and we ended up making our own Infinity stones which the kids think are out of this world. We are totally addicted and looking all around for some amazing stones to clean up next!
customer_reviews.author: Anne P.

customer_reviews.title: Great Company and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Update: I was contacted by the company and they mailed a new kit immediately and it is working great and my grandson couldn’t be happier. I bought this for my grandson as a Christmas gift. He just got started with his first batch of rock cleaning (purchased the gemstones) and the tumbler stopped worked before he was able to complete step 3 of the process. Not worth purchasing and disappointing an excited child when he can finish the project.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Best model for price
customer_reviews.text: We ended up with several rock tumblers for our kids at Christmas. This one I purchased for my oldest. It has been going strong now for two months with consistent use. It has outlasted 2 others that were a cheaper brand. It is fairly quiet, it runs in our school room and with the door shut it cannot be heard well. It tumbles smoothly compared to the other models. It only came with one pack of rocks with grit. The other kits came with more rocks and grit. So we are using the rocks and grit from the others.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie5643

customer_reviews.title: Relatively quiet, sturdy, well built
customer_reviews.text: I have been busy tumbling rocks using the four types of grit that came with the kit. The tumbler does run pretty quietly for a tumbler. I usually turn it off at night when I need to sleep, then turn it on before I leave for work in the morning. It will take at least 10 days to go through the whole process depending on the hardness scale of the rocks you are tumbling. The National Geographic rock tumbler appears to be of very good and durable quality. I wish I could buy one in the 5 gallon size; that is how hooked I am already on rock tumbling!
customer_reviews.author: DogMom

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt last
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item because I heard it was quitter. it actual is but it only lasted for 3 complete batches of rocks, that equates to 28 weeks of running. Now it wont run, it starts and stops with all lights flashing, I tried a new power adapter but that's not it, its actually the motor itself. Not sure who to contact about this but my other system which is louder still works and I have had it for over 7 years. Working to see what can be done.
customer_reviews.author: Dale W. Marino

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a high-quality machine!
customer_reviews.text: I love my rock tumbler, both me and my younger daughter's been using it, as soon as I got the product. We've already started tumbling stones, and the stones are looking beautiful, as we check on them. I would highly recommend this to anyone, who's interested in gemstones or minerals, if you want to polish them yourself. As for the noise level, it's not too bad, for the most part it's almost like running water, but I have to admit though, my wife can't stand it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Runs like a champ.
customer_reviews.text: So I've been using this machine for a couple months now. It's great for a gift to any age, setup is simple, it even comes with an extra o ring, used to run the tumbler. I would recommend using some kind of media to keep the rocks from beating each other up, and it helps bring down the sound more, which isn't even that load. All and all, I feel this is a great starter tumbling kit.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn carper

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 38 days
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing the tumbler, I did read quite a few reviews about the tumbler not working, but I figured I might be the exception. Tumbler quit tumbling after 38 days, just 8 days after return warranty expired! All the lights flash and resetting the power did not help. Did I get my money worth and was this tumbler a good investment? Absolutely NOT to my questions and I should of purchased the other brand I was comparing this too. GOOD LUCK if you buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie Price

customer_reviews.title: One happy 10 year old!
customer_reviews.text: Loud! LOL! But I have one very happy 10 year old polishing piles of rocks. Comes with everything you need. Clear instructions and easy to use. We put it in the basement because of the noise but that is something I'm picky about in the first place. I want to say it runs on three different grit types and up to 7 days or so for each?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rocks are NOT what is shown
customer_reviews.text: Edited: I posted a second picture to show the rocks after the 3rd stage of tumbling. SOOO disappointing but no way to contact the seller to request replacement just for the rocks We have a very disappointed 8 year old when he finally finished the first phase of tumbling to see this is what he got instead of the gems shown. He didn’t even receive all of the gems shown. Don’t get your kids hopes up 😢
customer_reviews.author: Nicole R.

customer_reviews.title: Really nice size tumbler for jewelry making
customer_reviews.text: My tumbler barrel was damaged and it cost more to replace than a new tumbler. Found this one (National Geographic's Dr. Cool) and it was a decent price. It is a really great tumbler for my sterling and copper jewelry pieces and quiet. It work hardens and polishes beautifully. While I didn't order it for the gemstones, grits, and accessories, it is good practice for tumbling rough gemstones. I have some rough emeralds I am going to experiment with.
customer_reviews.author: DGP

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: We went to Gatlinburg TN 2 years ago and bought a bucket of gem to pan for. I finally got around to buying the tumbler because my husband said it would be so loud we would hate it. I bought it and it’s adorable. We do keep it in the garage but the noise is not bad at all! It is like a box fan would make. We are on round 2 of 4 so I can’t show any pictures but it’s super cool to see the change so far.
customer_reviews.author: Raylene Cross

customer_reviews.title: Month long hobby
customer_reviews.text: The package did not come with the strainer that should have been included. First reaction- it's louder than I expected! Will need to use either in the garage or a place in your house that isn't used frequently. I'm excited to see the rocks once they're finished (a month from now). But since I haven't tested the product fully, this is all I can say so far.
customer_reviews.author: Firefly27

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for interested kids
customer_reviews.text: Love this item. My son has been wanting a rock tumbler and this was a perfect set. It does make noise, but almost a relaxing white noise kind of sound. We have it running in the playroom where it won’t disturb anyone. We are on step 2 of 4. It does take a while to polish the rocks, but that was expected. My son loves that the rocks and jewelry kit were included. Easy to use and exciting!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and quiet and a great value!
customer_reviews.text: So quiet! I set this up out on our condo balcony. I placed the unit on top of a couple of old bathroom rugs and placed the Amazon box over the top. You can't hear it even if you are sitting next to it! Update: July 24, 2020 This little unit has been running everyday since I bought it in Jan 2020. I tumble all kinds of rock and glass to add to my art. This has been one of the best purchases I have ever made!
customer_reviews.author: Norrie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use but YMMV
customer_reviews.text: Product works great and is easy to use, however regarding tumblers in general, you will need to do some learning before you will get good results. You will need additional grit, as well as plastic beads or other additives for good results. Also, be prepared to spend about a month tumbling for decent results, as will any other tumbler. The rubber tumbler runs cool and quiet however.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter for Christmas and she loves it. It is extremely loud so don't plan on keeping it inside your house. It came with a bag full of rocks and 4 different grits of sand to start with. I wish it would have come with more grit because now I have to buy more grit for her to do more rocks. This takes a lot of patient for a kid because it takes weeks for the rocks to get super smooth and shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Rach

customer_reviews.title: Great gift idea for kids.
customer_reviews.text: I mean obviously it's loud, but it is awesome! We just stuck it out in the garage to keep the noise down. My 9 year old absolutely loves this thing, as do I really. We went through the rocks and grit that came with it and it even surprised me at the difference from start to finish. We went to Chattanooga last year and he had gotten a bunch of rocks from there that needed to be tumbled. Bought some more grit and starting on the process again. Great gift idea as it keeps going for days/weeks and not over with in just a few hours.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Brown

customer_reviews.title: A fun little hobby
customer_reviews.text: My son and I have enjoyed using this over the summer. It sits out in the garage and spins away. It takes about a month to complete a set of rocks. It also requires practice before the rocks start coming out just the way you hope them to. We have learned a great deal about how to tumble over the course of the summer. Any good hobby is one that takes practice to get right so this one fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Peter V

customer_reviews.title: too weak to handle even the rocks it comes with
customer_reviews.text: if you overload it it will stop and you have to unplug it and restart it. Sometimes that happens quickly sometimes after a couple of days. But it wouldn't even handle the sample of rocks that it included with it! once I got to the third step I had to split it in half and only do a few rocks at a time. That means it would take over a month to do 1/4th of a pound of stone! That makes it basically worthless unless you have the patience of a saint. Do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Winters

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Education for the Grandkids
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a birthday gift for our 9 year old grandson. He has a keen interest in geology and rock collecting. Had been asking for one of these polishers for a couple years. Decided he was now old enough. He loves it! Currently is in the second stage of the process. One thing - this isn't an instant process - so its teaching him to follow the polishing steps and in about 20 days, he'll have the final product. So educational and also teaches patience!
customer_reviews.author: Titetown

customer_reviews.title: Nice thing if it would work.....
customer_reviews.text: Had the unit working just for a few days. It did stop working, all LEDs are ON all the time, not functional. The return timeline is very short ( just found out ), so if you buy this a month before you plan to give it as gift and the gadget does not work.... you are out of luck. Not happy at the moment.....
customer_reviews.author: Julian L

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: purchased this for my granddaughter. We started the process and seems it was working fine. On the 3rd grit level the machine just stopped, red light blinking. We removed a little water and tried again. It started up and we thought we were good but no.... it stopped again. I called Amazon and they told me I had to contact National Geographic. I got transferred around to 3 or 4 different departments till they told me that Amazon should replace this and that they NG would email Amazon to tell them that they (Amazon) had to replace the tumbler. Its been over 3 weeks and I have not heard from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: DebbieR

customer_reviews.title: Fun little gift
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 10 year old for Christmas and he loves it! He was so excied every time it was time to change the grit. The tumbler is noisy, but not horrible. We put it outside on our deck and it almost doubled as a sound machine because through the door as you walk past it sounds like rain. I love that it's easy to buy refills for this tumbler and the base is sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: BrandieB

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son as a Christmas gift. He had always wanted one. From the beginning it was a noisy unit. He put it in the garage to make conversation in the kitchen possible. On the plus side it seemed to do a good job of smoothing the rocks placed in the drum and was pretty simple to use. It lasted a bit shy of six months and stopped dead cold, never to tumble again. As my dear departed father used to say, "You get what you pay for.." Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Felix A. Raya

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, good quality, fun activity.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! I just started my first batch of rock they are coming along great. The set comes with everything you need including some rocks to polish. The equipment is durable. The motor and rocks churning makes a moderate amount of noise which is to be expected, I would recommend running it out in the garage or a basement because it’s a tad noisy. Just a heads up, the process of polishing the rocks is quite long, about a month, which I didn’t realize as a novice but you only have to check on the machine periodically and change out the water and grit 4 times so it’s just a few interventions. Very little work involved.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for adults and kids alike
customer_reviews.text: One tip: the noise level can be reduced by using plastic pellets. We have our two tumblers out in the garage, but the pellets greatly reduce the noise level. My only wish is the polishing grit actually polished. I need to do some more homework on that. However, this is a great starter pack and I highly recommend it due to its reliability. It is simple to use and we haven't had any problems for the months the items has continued to be used.
customer_reviews.author: A Wife, Mom, JediTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: I've had my tumbler for just over a year, have been running it a lot, and it's been working great for my daughter and me. Using the recommended Polly Plastics 4-step grit with this thing, my results have been better than I expected. For anybody that has had problems: read the directions carefully and follow them!
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Guy

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!!! But things to know!!!
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty loud but is expected I guess. It takes a long time I don't know why I thought would be a couple hour process. But it takes about a month to finish the end result is awesome but just a heads up before you start this with your kids and they are expecting a cool rock later that night lol The deisgn in cool is vrey great quality the shipper was awesome got it to me super quick and was packed well.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could give Zero Stars
customer_reviews.text: The machine will not stay on, automatically shuts off immediately after turning on for the FIRST TIME. All indicator lights light up and the tumbler stops, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY! I unfortunately purchased this in July and used it for the first time today ( to craft for Christmas Gifts) so I missed the return window. Extremely disappointing. I reached out to Amazon and Nat Geo, no response and no help. So frustrated. A complete waste of $60
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS DESCRIBED
customer_reviews.text: weight of rock 1.5 lbs added an extra tablespoon of grit herd need a tablespoon of grit per lbs of rock. Ran on grit 1 for 7 days grit 2 for 7 days grit 3 for 7 days 4 for 10 days. still not polished put back in grit 3 for 4 days going to put in 4 grit for 4 more days. will update in a few days UPDATE: Ran 4 more days on grit 3 and 4 more days on grit 4 still NOT polished TERRIBLE PRODUCT
customer_reviews.author: Steve Brown

customer_reviews.title: Don't do it. Save your rocks. Save your money. It ruined my stones.
customer_reviews.text: This was absolute garbage. It ruined my rocks. It was loud and took a while (do know its not a quick process, about 3 to 4 weeks). At the end of wasting my time and electricity, the results came out bad. It ruined my expensive rocks. It shrunk them in size and the rocks came out ashy and less color. Dont waste your money. I cant even get a return from this item because of the window to return, but the process takes a month so how can I return when the process of the timing is within that month??
customer_reviews.author: Dominique Mustoe

customer_reviews.title: Quit working before completing one cycle required to polish the stones.
customer_reviews.text: I have not had an opportunity to contact customer support yet but at this point this has failed before ever completing the 4 different grits required. Less than three weeks and it is not running and flashing lights. Update: I contacted customer service and they were extremely helpful. I changed the rating to 4 stars because of that. They stood behind the product 100% so I'm assuming I received a rare bad unit. If the replacement does better I'll be updating this to a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Arrived nonfunctional.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived nonfunctional. Belt that drives the roller kept flying off. This tumbler was for a 7-year-old who had been waiting patiently for it to arrive to tumble gems that she had “mined” while on vacation. Returning the product was not ideal and would have seriously disappointed our budding rock hound. I took a screwdriver to the screws next to the motor and was able to stabilize the wheel that drives the belt. The tumbler works as it should now, but I should not have to fix shoddy assembly. I’d advise choosing another unless you like returning things or are handy with a screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Hooper

customer_reviews.title: Broke before I could finish
customer_reviews.text: The motor just started to act up before I could finish a full cycle. After doing some research, I think I could spend just a bit more and get a more professional tumbler with two barrels. Assuming yours doesn't break, it's not terribly noisy, though I did put it in the garage. It sounded like we had a tiny hot tub out there.
customer_reviews.author: Reba M

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to an 8 year old boy for his birthday and he loves it! I don't know about the noise level, so I am neutral on that. Yes, this IS a nice gift for boys, but it is expensive. If an 8 year old boy can do this, well, I am sure other boys his age would do well also. My concern is this: he is 8! This so called toy will probably collect dust when they get tired of it. This is kind of an expensive toy!
customer_reviews.author: peachykeen

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't last very long...
customer_reviews.text: This product actually works and is easy to use. The instructions were very clear. We did one full round of about 12 rocks and they came out smooth and polished as advertised. However, I went to do a second round of rocks and the motor died. If you are into rock polishing, spend the extra money and buy a better, longer lasting product. Disappointed that National Geographic sold a product that only lasted about two months. I do not recommend anyone purchase this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a rock collector
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my niece's 7th birthday and she absolutely loves it. It was a great addition to the rocks she bought after a cave tour. She and her sisters enjoy checking on the rocks and seeing the progress. I was tempted to annoy my brother while saving ten dollars on the non-insulated one but based on other reviews it may have been over-kill. :) He told me they can still hear this one from the basement but I'm sure it's much quieter than the plastic container. Seems to be really high quality.
customer_reviews.author: Erica D.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, great for kids, even young kids with parental help
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic rock tumbler. We had a problem with the first one suddenly stopping on its own and the company was amazing to work with and quickly sent us a replacement. My boys really love this rock tumbler and love seeing the stones we get from it. It requires some parental support but it is not difficult at all. We really wanted something good quality, for kids, at a good price, and I really think this fit perfectly. Bonus is it comes from a really awesome company!
customer_reviews.author: jackjack

customer_reviews.title: Motor died after only ONE round of polishing!! Don't buy!
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased by my 12 year old who saved up all her money to buy it. She was so excited. We helped her learn how to load it, set it, clean it after each cycle, etc, and it died during the last cycle (polish) of her very first round of rocks (the ones they provide!!!). So disappointed. Since it takes so long for the rocks to spin for all the different rounds, we missed the return window. Ridiculous. My daughter is so unhappy. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SEA GLASS!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use the tumbler for it's intended purpose, however, it makes amazing Sea Glass! I've become really big into up-cycling, so I've been turning used jars, bottles into sea glass for our landscaping. Some of my friends have even donated their chipped or broken colored glass to the cause, with beautiful results! I can't wait to start using it for craft projects!
customer_reviews.author: Lilith Cain

customer_reviews.title: 9 year old likes this
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun gadget, but know that it takes a parent’s help and a kiddo’s patience. It is loud. You need to be able to put it in a garage. You won’t want it in your house. It needs to tumble constantly for like two weeks with little breaks for cleaning in between. There is no instant gratification. My 9 year old thought it was awesome.
customer_reviews.author: SKL

customer_reviews.title: We now have a beautiful set of polished rocks...
customer_reviews.text: that my grandson found while panning in the mountains. It did take about a month to go through all 4 polishes, but it was worth it. I put it in the laundry room so I couldn't hear it running as bad. That part I didn't care for too much. Next time we'll put it in the garage I think.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela W.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I finally decided to use it as we moved and it was boxes for a while. On day 3 of use the damn thing broke in two places!!!! I only had 6-8 very small rocks in the tumbler so it wasn't overloaded. I don't usually write reviews but I'm so disgusted that I wasted my money on something so poorly made. Lesson learned.
customer_reviews.author: Raven Rodriguez

product_meta.title: NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC Hobby Rock Tumbler Kit - Includes Rough Gemstones, 4 Polishing Grits, Jewelry Fastenings and Detailed Learning Guide - Great STEM Science Kit for Mineralogy and Geology Enthusiasts
product_meta.description:
Style:Hobby KitLearn about the exciting hobby of rock tumbling with National Geographic!

Rock tumbling is tons of fun and a great way to start a beautiful rock collection.

This set includes all the accessories you’ll need to start polishing dazzling gems. 

Kids can use the included jewelry fastening to create beautiful homemade jewelry!

Contents and Features:

• High-quality tumbling machine with powerful motor that will last for years
• Automatic shutoff timer so you can set it and forget it 
• Noise reducing leak-proof barrel with stainless steel lid
• Half pound of gemstones from around the world (9 types) and four grades of grit
• Jewelry fastenings so you can create your own unique jewelry
• Full-color information guide with cool facts about each of the gemstones included
• Easy-to-follow rock tumbling instructions
• 2-year manufacturer warranty

Rock tumbling is a fun activity for children of all ages and promotes an interest in geology and science. 

Introduce your kid to science the fun way! Join National Geographic as we inspire future generations by showing them the wonders of the natural world.

National Geographic Toys is proud to provide a 100% satisfaction guarantee with all our products so that you can buy with confidence.

About the National Geographic Society: With a mission to inspire people to care about the planet, the 126-year-old National Geographic Society is one of the world’s largest nonprofit scientific and educational organizations.

National Geographic’s net proceeds support vital exploration, conservation, research, and education programs.
feature_bullets: MAKE ANY STONE SPARKLE - Polish everyday rocks into dazzling gemstones
ENHANCE YOUR ROCK COLLECTION - Or start a new one! Makes all rocks shine like professionally polished stones
EVERYTHING IS INCLUDED - This kit includes the tumbler, four polishing grits, sifter, learning guide PLUS nine types of real rough gemstones
EASY TO USE - Simple instructions, one-touch settings and an automatic shutoff timer

SATISFACTION GUARANTEE - For 131 years, National Geographic has been committed to providing fun and fascinating educational opportunities for children and stands behind this Rock Tumbler with a two-year warranty

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,966 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
